snippet: The airline had increased security in response to political turmoil, Islamist terrorism and “We will bring this plane down” once being written on the plane that crashed Thursday.
abstract: EgyptAir security officials reveal Airbus A320 that crashed into Mediterranean Sea was target of threatening graffiti in 2014; say incident had been trigger for initiation of stricter security measures by airline.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH, NOUR YOUSSEF and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and Merna Thomas from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The airline had increased security in response to political turmoil, Islamist terrorism and “We will bring this plane down” once being written on the plane that crashed Thursday.

headline.main: EgyptAir Was Aware of Threats to Security, Including One Scribbled on Plane
headline.print_headline: Amid Threats, Airline Tightened Its Security
